intro: Geniostoma kaalae, commonly known as the Hawaiian flame flower, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is native to the Hawaiian Islands and is characterized by its striking red, tubular flowers. The plant has a woody stem with smooth, dark green leaves that are elliptical in shape. It thrives in tropical climates and requires well-drained soil and full sunlight. Geniostoma kaalae is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is a symbol of the unique flora of Hawaii.
